ratings.comment: Christine is absolutely awesome. If you ever get the pleasure of having her as a professor, get to know her. She is a great resource in and out of the class. She truly cares about your progress, and I genuinely liked the class because she made it enjoyable.
She is an absolute sweet heart in class. Dont expect to know what grade you have on any assignment until after the final paper. Be on her good side and you'll be just fine.

EPD 155: Very nice teacher. Lectures are pointless but attendance matters. She is really understanding. 8 one page papers. 2 oral presentations. 1 group paper. 1 final paper that is 8-12 pages depending on what she requires. No tests. Easy grader and it is an easy A if you have confidence in your writing.

Dr. Stephenson is a wonderful professor. She is always so encouraging, respectful, and helpful when it comes to her students. There were no tests for this class. The coursework consisted of one page responses to readings as well as a group project and an individual research project of your choosing. Would highly recommend taking this class. Easy A
Great professor, assigned less than average easy work with 2 or so bigger assignments.  Did not update grades throughout semester.

She is a very energetic professor that is very helpful and approachable.  The class was mostly just a group project and a large final project at the end of the semester.  My only complaint is that I wasn't able to see most of my grades until the final grade was posted.
She is an awesome instructor as well as a person. Very easy going and very willing to help you out. Very personable too.
Super nice and very much into her profession. Her energy makes, what should be, a boring class, into an exciting one

Christine is the nicest professor I have had at UW. She is very helpful and will look over any project you send to her. That being said, the expectations are non existent and I had no idea where my grade was until it was submitted as she puts nothing in the grade book. These criticisms aside I would highly recommend the course with her.

There are few professors that I feel comfortable approaching in this University, And Prof. Stephenson definitely tops the list. She's super nice and though she may grade a bit strictly (given that they are scholarly articles, that's kind of a given) she provides great feedback to help you improve. Trust me EPD 155 with her was the best class ever.
Professor Stephenson was extremely nice and helpful. She was always prepared and willing to help.
Answers e-mails quickly and thoroughly ensuring everyone understands the material.  Super nice and approachable
Christine is a very passionate professor who cares about her students. She is a very fair grader and as long as you complete her four assignments on time you should be fine in her class... NO TESTS!!

I loved this class so much! Christine is super helpful, nice, and understanding. If you have things going on outside of college she is very understanding that you have other priorities besides class. She's very passionate about English and will do anything to help you succeed!
Christine is the best! She is very helpful, she helps with anything that you need! She will take time out of her day for you and is a great teacher! The class is set up great!

Christine is an awesome professor who knows what she is talking about.  She grades super easy and there are only three big essay that you have to do (only one with research)! She is so nice and friendly!  I highly recommend her to everyone.  If you have a chance to take a class with Christine you really should.
Christine treats students with respect and goes out of her way to help you in any way possible.  She offers great feedback and at the end of her class you definately are a better writer.
This was a very interesting class.  I really liked how Christine set it up.
